headline: Down 7%, Should You Buy the Dip on Palantir Technologies?
summary: Palantir's rapid growth in both the commercial and governmental artificial intelligence (AI) markets demonstrate the company is an early leader in the sector.  Is now the time to buy Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) stock?  True, as of this writing, shares of Palantir are only 7% off their all-time high, but there haven't been many opportunities to buy this stock on a dip.

headline: Palantir Unveils Warp Speed Initiative with Navy Support
summary: Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR) is among the 11 best places to invest money without risk. Palantir Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ:PLTR), together with BlueForge Alliance (BFA), which is a nonprofit integrator supporting the U.S. Navy’s efforts to strengthen the maritime industrial base, has launched Warp Speed for Warships. headline: What Stanley Druckenmiller's Exit From Palantir Says About His Investment Strategy and Why It Matters
summary: Stanley Druckenmiller is one of the best investors of all time.  From 1981 to 2010, Druckenmiller never had a losing year, achieving an average annual return of 30% with his hedge fund Duquesne Capital Management, a phenomenal track record.

headline: Should You Worry About Palantir's Valuation?
summary: Palantir stock has soared in the quadruple digits over three years.  At the same time, valuation also has surged -- and some investors consider the stock quite expensive right now.  Palantir Technologies (NASDAQ: PLTR) has had a lot going for it in recent quarters.

headline: Meme stocks vs. fundamentals: Where you should invest
summary: Listen and subscribe to Stocks In Translation on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast.Are meme stocks just noise or the market's new normal?In this episode of Stocks in Translation, Investopedia editor in chief Caleb Silver joins Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Allie Canal and Producer Sydnee Fried to discuss the resurgence of meme stocks and how investors should be approaching the market in this ever-changing landscape. Silver uses Palantir (PLTR) as an example. While many consider it a meme stock, Silver argues the data analytics software company has become more established, especially as it continues building ties with both corporate America and the US government. Later on, the trio takes a look at bitcoin (BTC-USD) and the future of cryptocurrency in the United States. Twice a week, Stocks In Translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. You can find more episodes here, or watch on your favorite streaming service. This post was written by Lauren Pokedoff
